adhammā.example_1: ordinary people are fixed in wrong principles.

adhammaṃ.sutta_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu subhāsitaṃyeva bhāsati no dubbhāsitaṃ, dhammaṃyeva bhāsati no adhammaṃ, piyaṃyeva bhāsati no appiyaṃ, saccaṃyeva bhāsati no alikaṃ.
adhammaṃ.example_1: It’s when a mendicant speaks well, not poorly; their speech is principled, not unprincipled; they speak pleasantly, not unpleasantly; and they speak truthfully, not falsely.
adhammaṃ.comment: masc, what is unprincipled, against reality

ativijjha.sutta_1: tenāhaṃ etarahi kāyena ca phusitvā viharāmi, paññāya ca ativijjha passāmī’ti.
ativijjha.example_1: But now I have direct meditative experience of them, and see them with penetrating wisdom.’
